abstract: Inclusion of poem by Michael Derrick Hudson, which was submitted under Chinese pseudonym Yi-Fen Chou, in 2015 Best American Poetry anthology sparks debate over racial diversity, entitlement and tokenism in publishing; Hudson claims using Asian name has been successful strategy for getting his work published; editor Sherman Alexie, who debated decision after learning author's true identity but ultimately keep poem based on its merit, welcomes heightened interest in poetry brought by controversy.
lead_paragraph: Sherman Alexie, editor of the “Best American Poetry” anthology, noted that despite the headaches, the controversy showed how much passion discussion of poetry can stir.

headline.main: A White Poet Borrows a Chinese Name and Sets Off Fireworks
headline.print_headline: Hackles Rise Over Poet’s Use of Chinese Name
